intro: Pentapterygium rugosum, commonly known as the roughleaf pentapterygium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, textured leaves and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
